page.title: 10The Milking Parlour.
page.content: We went to the milking parlour at Fulling Bridge Farm. 80 cows were milked that day, 70 more were dry in preparation for calving. The parlour had 8 stalls each side. The stalls were made to measure to fit the herd of Friesian Holsteins, which are long cows. Dave the cowman stood in a well set in the middle of the parlour. The clusters were raised and the gates opened automatically. When the cluster was fitted onto the teats of the udder the milked was sucked out by alternat- ing pressure in the cups,and ran down a tube into a large glass collecting jar. When the milk flow stopped the clusters fell off automatically and Dave applied an antiseptic solution to the teats. The milk was pumped into a large cooling tank to await collection by tanker lorry. Elaine Taylor age 11. Matthew Taylor age 9.
